org.rootsdev.polygenea

Class UUID5

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rootsdev.polygenea.UUID5

  • public class UUID5
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains static methods that leverage UUID and MessageDigest to create version-5 UUIDs with full namespace support.

    The UUID class provided by java.util is suitable as a datatype for UUIDs of any version, but lacks methods for creating version 5 (SHA-1 based) UUIDs. Its implementation of version 3 (MD5 based) UUIDs also lacks build-in namespace support.

    This class was informed by RFC 4122. Since RFC 4122 is vague on how a 160-bit hash is turned into the 122 free bits of a UUID (6 bits being used for version and variant information), this class was modelled after java.util.UUID's type-3 implementation and validated against the D language's phobos library std.uuid, which in turn was modelled after the Boost project's boost.uuid; and also validated against the Python language's uuid library.

    Author:
    Luther Tychonievich. Released into the public domain. I would consider it a courtesy if you cite my contributions to any code derived from this code or project that uses this code.
    See Also:
    UUID, MessageDigest

      • fromBytes

        public static java.util.UUID fromBytes(byte[] name)
        Similar to UUID.nameUUIDFromBytes, but does version 5 (sha-1) not version 3 (md5)
        Parameters:
        name - The bytes to use as the "name" of this hash
        Returns:
        the UUID object

      • fromBytes

        public static java.util.UUID fromBytes(java.util.UUID namespace,
                                       byte[] name)
        Similar to UUID.nameUUIDFromBytes, but does version 5 (sha-1) not version 3 (md5) and uses a namespace
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to use for this UUID. If null, uses 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
        name - The bytes to use as the "name" of this hash
        Returns:
        the UUID object

      • fromUTF8

        public static java.util.UUID fromUTF8(java.lang.String name)
        Similar to UUID.nameUUIDFromBytes, but does version 5 (sha-1) not version 3 (md5)
        Parameters:
        name - The string to be encoded in utf-8 to get the bytes to hash
        Returns:
        the UUID object

      • fromUTF8

        public static java.util.UUID fromUTF8(java.util.UUID namespace,
                                      java.lang.String name)
        Similar to UUID.nameUUIDFromBytes, but does version 5 (sha-1) not version 3 (md5) and uses a namespace
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to use for this UUID. If null, uses 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
        name - The string to be encoded in utf-8 to get the bytes to hash
        Returns:
        the UUID object
